text:
NO OZONE LAYER PROTECTING US FROM UV IN THE SUN
There's no ozone layer atop our atmosphere protecting us from the sun. At the top of our atmosphere is hydrogen2, the lightest gas, and possibly ionized hydrogen.

The scientific "fact" that says there's ozone layer protecting us from the UV rays of the sun is false. This is indicated by the list below of the molecular weights of gases.

As the list below indicates, heavy ozone can exist mainly near the ground, together with carbon dioxide or smoke.

Science is a religion that feeds on ignorance. And they have been keeping us ignorant throughout history.

(And whether the earth is cooling or heating up is not within the control of man. The earth is a highly automated machine, with heating from the sun above and volcanoes below.) 


MOLECULAR WEIGHTS OF GASES:
 	
hydrogen  1.00794 g/mol  
hydrogen2 2.016 g/mol
     
helium  4.002602 g/mol        	

oxygen 15.9994 g/mol

air 28,96 g/mol
oxygen2 32 g/mol    

nitrogen2 28.013 g/mol

carbon dioxide 44.010 g/mol
ozone 47.9982 g/mol

Conclusion: there's no ozone layer in the sky that's destroyed by refrigerants, etc.

Source:
https://www.engineeringtoolbox.com/molecular-mass-air-d_679.html

text: Thermometre readings all over the globe have shown general warming for decades.  This is a matter of record.  This shows up whether you include urban instruments or not.  There are two and only two ways to heat the planet: either we recieve more energy or we hang on to more.  The sun is our external source of energy.  We've had satellites directly measuring its' output for decades.  It's actually putting out a miniscule amount less energy. so the sun isn't the cause of increased warming.  The warming is happening over too much of the globe to be a simple change in large weather patterns like the Medieval warm period.  If this was a redistribution of heat from other parts of the globe we'd see them get colder.  The upper layers of the ocean are getting warmer but the layers underneath aren't getting colder so that's not the source.  Bore hole measurements around the globe reveal the same level of subsurface heat so that's not it.  The upper layer of the atmosphere is getting colder but it's normally colder than the layers below and heat doesn't travel en masse from cold areas to warm.  Also since the surface is warmer there should be more heat convecting and radiating up while the sun is still providing the same heat from the top so that's not the source either.  The heat absorbing properties of gasses like CO2 have been well understood for well over 150 years now and the amount of them in the air is the only thing that's changed while we've been observing warming.  If anyone has a better culprit in mind then I'm keen to hear it.  In the meantime that heat will do what heat normally does: cause stuff to expand, melt ice and evaporate increasing amounts of moisture into the air only to fall out in greater amounts elsewhere.

Part of the issue isn‚Äôt just that people don‚Äôt believe in the science. A major divide right now is based on politics and political activism. Many skeptics are simply not convinced that government is the solution to tackling issues, and as such, shouldn‚Äôt be the solution. 

It‚Äôs not just that people deny the Earth is warming. A great chunk see human innovation as the solution. And as a result, those of us who do get labeled as science deniers by political activists because they simply cannot see how individuals in a free market can solve the issues we face.

text:
What I've read is, Water vapor and greenhouse gases, absorb IR photons sending most of them back into space cooling the earth by reducing the sun's heat that is able to make it to the earth's surface. 

https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/features/EnergyBalance/page6.php 

"Just as the major atmospheric gases (oxygen and nitrogen) are transparent to incoming sunlight, they are also transparent to outgoing thermal infrared. However, water vapor, carbon dioxide, methane, and other trace gases are opaque to many wavelengths of thermal infrared energy." "When greenhouse gas molecules absorb thermal infrared energy, their temperature rises. Like coals from a fire that are warm but not glowing, greenhouse gases then radiate an increased amount of thermal infrared energy in ALL DIRECTIONS". "Because greenhouse gas molecules radiate heat in ALL DIRECTIONS, some of it spreads downward and ultimately comes back into contact with the Earth‚Äôs surface, where it is absorbed. The temperature of the surface becomes warmer than it would be if it were heated only by direct solar heating. This supplemental heating of the Earth‚Äôs surface by the atmosphere is the natural greenhouse effect." Up high or down low, I don't see any difference if NASA is correct. At the height of the Atmosphere, the Earth constitutes 1/3rd of the space. So the IR absorbed by the ghg, both for incoming sun heat and emitted Earth heat, will be absorbed then emitted in "all directions". 1/3rd will hit the Earth below and the other 2/3rds will go into space. Of the Earth emitted heat, 1/3rd of that will be absorbed by the ghgs going out, and sent back to the earth adding additional warming to the earth, this warming is the greenhouse effect according to NASA. So, water vapor and the ghgs, cool the earth by blocking out 66.4% of Sun heat, while keeping in only 11% (1/3rd of 1/3rd). The atmosphere keeps out six times more heat than it keeps in. If we add more molecules of CO2 they will absorb more entering sun heat and cool the earth more than they do now. With the earth getting less heat, there will be less heat to keep in, so the GHE should fall. I don't see how, if NASA is correct, we can be warming the planet by adding more CO2 to the atmosphere.

text:
I have the utmost respect for science. I have never doubted the scientific consensus concerning the acidification of the oceans, rising temperatures, increasing severity of wild fires and hurricanes. I have never doubted that increasing levels of carbon dioxide is the cause and that human activity is the source of that increase. However, you must also weigh the consequences of reducing carbon emissions. That is what thoughtful people do.

The other day I heard someone claim that we must eliminate carbon emissions now. I thought to myself, "How could anyone be so stupid that they could actually say such a thing?" Think about it. What would I have to do to eliminate my carbon emissions. Well, first I would have to stop breathing. Every time I breathe out I am spewing carbon dioxide into the air. Let's leave this one though. Assume it's ok for me to breathe. Let's concentrate on activities that involve fossil fuels. So,  I would not be able to drive my Toyota Prius because it uses gas. Perhaps I could drive an electric car? Well no. I live in an area where my electricity is generated by burning coal. So, while driving electric would be better than driving my Prius, it would not be allowed. Since my electricity come from coal, I would have to unplug my refrigerator and freezer. My potable water is pumped using fossil fuel energy so say goodbye to my water supply. I guess I would have hunt small game and cook it over a wood fire. I would be dead in a few days or few weeks at most. I do not have the skills to live without energy from fossil fuels.

The immediate consequences of not using fossil fuels are far far worse than the consequences of continuing to use them. This is also a fact every bit as much as the fact of global warming. Not recognizing this fact is just plain stupid. 

The problem with climate change is that it is a huge problem with no simple solutions. Creating a world that does not depend on fossil fuels will require the energy of a lot of fossil fuel. Global warming is something that has already happened. As I write this California is having the worst wild fire season in history. But life goes on. Rising sea levels will not extinguish human life. People will move long before they are knee deep in water. 

What we need is rationality.  We need engineering. We need to know costs of doing nothing and the costs doing various somethings and then somehow make collective decisions about what should be done.

A few other arguements I‚Äôve created: 
1. Algae, already inhaling half of all the co2 that‚Äôs being inhaled and having exponential growth and the entire ocean to grow, may out grow co2 emissions ( I cant find a lot of studies on algae that can prove/disprove this but it would be fairly easy to test this, I think)
2. The sun, emitting different frequencies of light, emits different ‚Äúamounts‚Äù of different frequencies when their are more or less sunspots on the surface. Although the total solar irradiance seems to be hightened by the decrease of sunspots as shown by NASA, their is still the possibility that the lowering number of sunspots has caused frequency shifting in the light coming from the sun, and therefore more light could be absorbed at the surface of the earth where it is ‚Äútrapped‚Äù better than inside higher layers of the atmosphere. Frequency shifting could potentially warm the earth in many other ways. 
3. The earths magnetic dipole are moving away from true north and south, which may cause more charged particles to enter the atmosphere and heat the earth. This may not seem obvious because true north seems perpindicular to the direction the suns light is coming from, however it is more obvious when you notice that true north is actually slanted and is not completely perpindicular. This is relevant  because magnet poles and other areas of a magnetic field are stronger  than others, and so stronger areas of earths magnetic field will be better at stopping charged particles than others.

author: Dundoril

text:
¬†@Dundoril¬† Average temperature is just a mathematical invention. If you say, Sun can only heat Earth's surface to an average temperature of -18¬∞C, what is this mean? This is nothing close to reality. Moon's average surface temperature is -20¬∞C, but in reality you have temperature span from 120¬∞C during Moon's day and -170¬∞C during Moon's night.
And same problem we have with Earth. Earth's surface temperature is -18¬∞C, if Earth would not have atmosphere. So, max and low temperatures would be about the same as on Moon.
Now let's look what climate science is doing.
They are treating Earth as if it was flat. They give entire Earth's surface same temperature. Entire earth's surface have the same amount of incoming solar energy. There is no day and night cycle, no difference in solar radiation between the equator and the pole. No Earth's tilt. Everything is average.
According to climate science, surface that adding heat faster than atmosphere can dissipate it, the temperature will go up. OK, I have no problem with that, I totally agree. This is how climate scientists think that Earth's average surface temperature get from -18¬∞C to 15¬∞C hence, atmosphere is warming the planet's surface, more specific greenhouse gases. And this temperature rise is called the greenhouse effect.  BUT! Only because climate science treat Earth as if it was flat.
http://mpe.dimacs.rutgers.edu/images/climate-system-energy-balance/
That means that entire earth's surface is receiving continuously flow of incoming solar energy, that means that entire earth's surface continuously emitting heat with equal strength into atmosphere and if atmosphere can't dissipate it fast enough, the temperature will go up! We have greenhouse effect!
Sorry to tell you but Earth's surface is not an average value. There is no square meter on Earth's surface that receive continuously flow of incoming solar energy non-stop. So, it can not emit constant heat to atmosphere. Longer the night, less heat it emits... it's cooling down.
The temperature during a day here on Earth is all Sun's work. Atmosphere don't help one bit to warm the earth (It actually prevent to be even hotter) during a day. But night is a different story. Surface that was heated during a day by Sun, emits it during a night in a form of long-wave radiation and what intercepts this? A water vapor and some little good ol' CO2. Problem is that CO2 and water vapor intercept just a part of this outgoing long-wave radiation. They can't completely stop the cooling proces. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lsMWUK4WGkk&list=PLX2gX-ftPVXVzU5jGY3FaYEuuu3ANvMZb&index=21
Water vapor do main bulk of work, CO2 helps a little, methane effect is so small and overlaps with water vapor. CO2 effect is almost already at max.
All and all! ''Greenhouse gases'' just slow down the cooling of the Earth's surface during a night, and not actually warm it.
You see, CO2 is harmless. And mainstream climate science is BS.

author: Jernej Blatnik

text: ¬†@Jernej Blatnik¬† You just don't understand. We have more instances of strong wind and wild weather in the 21st century compared to any other time. Not that they suddenly start occurring, but the rate at which incidents of strong wind  occurred increased. For example, one year, there were 160 incidents of strong wind. The next year, there were 500 incidents of strong wind. In this case, the rate of strong wind increased, yet strong wind was never suddenly born. Stop denying that the rate went up. Try this: Plot the number of named storms(all of them are significant) using a bar graph in which the x axis shows every year and the y axis shows the number of named storms in any given year. You will see that there is a trend of named storms going up. Named storms don't suddenly come in, but the rate at which they form slowly increases. As you can see, 2005 is an outlier, but the number of named storms  is slowly(or quickly depending on how you see the bar graph) going upwards. This debunks why I am correct. Using a bit of actual evidence, I can piece together that the rate of named storm formation is actually increasing(neat, isn't it). Also, you can compare the total number of named storms today with the 1990s. There is a very big increase. Tropical storms shouldn't even be a thing--they should be classified as hurricanes, because tropical storms are very dangerous(here in Brooklyn a building collapsed from Isaias and a tree fell on an elderly person, causing him to die). I'm thinking that you don't live in a place with tropical storms because you don't seem to understand how dangerous they are. Even with remnants of storms, there is costal flooding even with gale warnings mixed in. You can expect at least 2 inches of rain. Even if hurricanes come within 1000 miles of NYC, you can expect everyone to tell you NOT to go in the water.

text: ¬†@JeffJests¬† Atmosphere doesn't warm the planet, it just slow down the cooling proces. It's the sun who warms the planet. And main 'greenhouse gas' (99%) that prevent quick cooling is water vapour, not CO2 or methane.
author: Jernej Blatnik

text: ¬†@Jernej Blatnik¬† slowing down the cooling process literally means trapping heat. Water vapor is insignificant in the sky as it forms clouds. Clouds are white and white things reflect heat, thus cooling the planet. CO2, NO2, and CH4 stay in the atmosphere for a considerably longer time.
author: JeffJests

text:
¬†@JeffJests¬† You are saying that greenhouse gases are warming the planet.
It's like saying that isolation alone warm your house. You must have a heat source. 
Water vapour is insignificant? Why are arguing here, if you have no idea what you talking about? Most idiotic thing I ever read. 
Clouds are water vapour. 
Clouds are actually keep Earth cool. That's why Moon noon temperature is 100¬∞C. ISS have the same problem, side that is facing the sun can go up to 120¬∞C. Earth never get 120¬∞C during a day, thanks to water vapour and our atmosphere. 
Point is that clouds during a night time significantly slow down the cooling. Cloudy nights are was warmer than clear sky nights. During a day, cloudy sky is colder than clear sky day.
That's why in deserts, where you have low humidity, you have the highest midday temperatures on Earth, but because of same low humidity, you have the coldest nights on Earth.
There is only 0.04% of CO2, 0.000002% of NO2 and 0.0007% of CH4 in our atmosphere. There is about 1-4% of water vapour in our atmosphere. Even when water vapor is at low point there is 100 times more water molecules than CO2.
author: Jernej Blatnik

text: ¬†@Jernej Blatnik¬† you dont have any proof for clouds make the area warmer. In fact it is the opposite. I checked my local weather, and on days that were partly cloudy(and no rain), the highs were 3 degrees lower and the lows(temperature measured at night) were 7 degrees colder than a cloudless night. Explain this if you believe in the contrary. It's not about humidity causing hot or cold temperatures. Because deserts have no water, it is rare for it to rain. Mountains are also blocking the path for storm systems to end up there. The moisture falls down before it reaches to the desert. the effects by CO2, NO2 and CH4 are much greater than water vapor(hundreds to thousands time the effect of water vapor). Our atmosphere acts as a buffer zone between the heat from the sun and the pleasant temperatures on earth. For example, mercury is hot because it is close to the sun and it has no atmosphere. Mars, on the other hand is very cold because it is far away from the sun. I doubt you even understand how greenhouse gases cause the earth to warm up. Water, which is H2O, has a slightly negative charge at the O and a slightly positive charge at the H. This is because the electronegativity of H is much less than the electronegativity of O. Therefore, the electrons are much closer to O despite being a covalent bond. Because of this lopsidedness, the energy of the sun is turned into heat energy. This is why O2 and N2 aren't greenhouse gases. They are symmetrical in electronegativity. This means that they aren't able to release heat. Imagine H20 as a spring. when you push the ends of the spring together, you have a lot of potential energy, but when you release, the spring bounces back and forth. This is kinetic energy and heat energy.

What you also need to know:
1) It is completely ludicrous to claim that we know the world average temperature with a precision of less than 0.1 degree, especially before the 1980.  The graphs that show a steady rise since the 1880 are mostly fabrications/
2) There is no experimental evidence that man made CO2 is the main culprit of the rise of temperature. They are all based on models, and they do not know at all how precise they are. there is a good reason why there are over 20 models used. If they understood the physics  well, they would know which one is more reliable.
3) Climate alarmists like to start in 1979 when they say that arctic ice has decreased a lot because 1979 was at a low temperature in Europe and the US.
4) In the 1970's they were saying that the Maldives were the canary in the mine for seas rises. They were predicting that it would be under water by the 2000.  In the 2000s, they predicted they would be underwater by 2020. Now they say it will be underwater by 2050.

text: It is fundamental that if the energy from the Sun is not changing then the equilibrium temperature of the Earth cannot change. If greenhouse gases "trap" energy, ( I was taught that as a rule energy always flows from hot to cold) and make the Earth warmer, it must logically radiate more energy than it did before due to the increased temperature. It can only do this if the energy it is receiving has increased but we are told it has not. The logic seems to be that the radiation that interacts with greenhouse gases would pass straight through the atmosphere without warning it. Once the radiation is used by greenhouse gases to warm the atmosphere instead, the rate of energy leaving the Earth cannot change, if it did the Earth would no longer be in equilibrium with the energy from the Sun. On any planet that has an atmosphere, regardless of the type of gases the temperature increases as you pass down through the atmosphere. The surface temperature appears to depend on the thickness of the atmosphere and it compression due to gravity.

18. To Make The World A Better Place

Humans build homes to stay, while animals just live in caves, live in the open field or just dig mud and stay. We humans for making homes cut down trees of the forest and then build homes. By this trees are getting reduced. Nowadays many people do not have to eat. If humans too stopped building homes and live in the open forest, trees would grow everywhere and so many fruits would be in the trees. If this is done no living being humans or animals would starve, because at present when we cut trees, so many birds and many animals which eat the trees fruits and leaves have to find some another tree. We would have to build schools, colleges, hospitals because without that we can't help ourselves. For clothes just we should hand stitch and just use white colour, because if we colour the clothes, pollution occurs. No plastic buttons should be used, only rubber buttons should be used. If there are no homes people could go anywhere, no need for two neighbouring countries to fight for land dispute at countries boundaries. At present what we are doing it is polluting the world and one day a major earthquake, tsunami, super volcano would come and many lives would be lost. So if we too lived in the open forest there will be no pollution, also our foods would be without chemicals. The very important thing no living being would starve.

We should live in the open forest as animals live and we have to survive. We have to find how to survive without harming the environment. Is there any choice, there is no other choice, we have to stop building homes. If we keep on building homes, then one day the whole lands of the world would be homes. When we build homes, we need so many things like mud, sea mud, cement, iron. They have to be transported from one place to another. For transportation we need vehicles and then for vehicles to operate we need petrol, diesel, oil. To get petrol we have to make oil rig platforms in the sea or land. For digging petrol so many machines have to be made. We need iron to make machines. We have to set up factories to make machines. But if we don't build homes to stay and live in the open forest as animals live, then we do not need the above said things. The above said things which when created and used creates pollution. If we don't use them, pollution also won't occur. Previously in the past when humans did live in open forest or caves, at that time all the animals, birds did have plenty to eat the fruits and leaves of the trees. Even humans before knowing fire, certainly they used to eat raw foods and somehow lived their life. When humans started building homes, after that forests became homes, trees were cut down and then the animals have to find some another tree for their food. Living in the open forest seems very hard but we have to find out to live somehow. Research should be made on this on a large scale. At present we are researching life on other planets and finding how to settle on moon and mars and even if that is possible we will one day pollute moon and mars and then we would have to go to some other planets. So much money is being spent on that. That research should be stopped till the earth is ok and that money should be used for researching on how to live in the open forest.

At present if we have to live in the open forest, it is impossible. We would have to face many problems. 14. Medicines To Be Produced In A Different Way

We manufacture tablet and syrup medicines in a manufacturing company. The tablet and syrup medicines have to be prepared in vast quantities and then tablets has to be packed in a packet and syrups in a bottle. Whatever the tablet and syrup medicines contain for any type of illness, they would have made it from some type of chemicals. Transportation is needed and many other things are also needed. The pollution and waste gases generated from these companies are so much. We should treat illness from natural foods, plants, leaves, fruits or grasses for small to medium types of illness. We should research what type of foods, plants, leaves, fruits or grasses should be given to eat to the ill person to cure their illnesses. The ill person would go to a doctor and the doctor would tell them what foods, etc., should be eaten so that their illness could get cured and how much amount of food has to be consumed. The person would buy those foods and consume it. Major or urgency types of illness for that we have to use allopathy only, as it may be risky for the patients with ayurvedic, homeopathic, and other forms of treatment. The world should research on this method and if this method works then we won't need so much medicines manufacturing companies, so much warehouses won't be needed to store the medicines, so much machines won't be needed to prepare the medicines, so much transportation won't be needed to transport the medicines to so many places and all the things related with it and so pollution could be avoided. We could turn all that places back to forests. These companies require so much boring underground water, the water when pumped out of the ground they flatten and sink the ground.
But we would need medicines manufacturing companies for things such as glucose bottles, syringes, injections and other things like that.

15. A Manufacturing Company Which Is Not A Necessity For Human Beings, If It Is Stopped, Then We Have The Following Benefits

When a manufacturing company which is not a necessity for human beings, if it is stopped, then we have the following benefits.
That company which is built in a place, that much land is saved, machines does not have to be manufactured, for machines to operate oil is needed and many other things, for which we have to make oil manufacturing company and all other companies for all other things like cartoon boxes, plastic ropes and plastic cans, registers, pencil, pen, stationery products. To make cartoon boxes papers are required and to stick papers gums are required. To make gums so much dough is needed and caustic soda is needed. If we don't manufacture cartoon boxes then that dough can be eaten. Transportation is needed to deliver things to all the shops. Roads have to be constructed. For transportation we need vehicles and to operate vehicles petrol is needed, to get petrol we have to set up oil rig platforms in the sea or land and to deliver petrol to a petrol pump that petrol is needed to be put in a drum, a plastic drum has to be manufactured and then many ships have to be manufactured for shipping the petrol to all the places. For all this works so much land is lost and so much pollution is created, from that pollution humans, land animals, sea animals, aerial animals and earth is suffering. Also many transportation items which requires huge trucks for transportation a driver has to drive only at night and his day life is lost. Surely at night time driving the driver would become sleepy sometimes and accidents do happen. 
All of this can be reduced and this will be our benefits if we stopped a manufacturing company which is not a necessity for human beings. When you stop making a manufacturing company then all the problems related with it won't occur.

16. Why We Should Manufacture Less Nutrient Foods Like Horlicks And Bournvita

Bournvita, Horlicks should be given to only persons who cannot exercise and are too weak. For others who have deficiency and are not too weak, they should eat natural foods and exercise so that the foods would get absorbed well in their body and their deficiency would be alright. If still they cannot exercise and get tired easily, they could do some light exercises or yoga in their spare time which would take long to get tired. If this is done, we won't have to prepare so many horlicks, bournvita and other nutrients foods like that. So then we don't have to prepare the plastic, glass or paper pack bottles and hence less pollution.

17. To Reduce Television Time

Television programs is for 24 hours a day. A human works for 8 hours a day, 1 hour for getting ready in the morning, travelling time assume for 2 hours a day, half an hour would be spent in relaxing, talking to friend's for half an hour, talking with family for half an hour, 1 hour spent in a park and sleeping time for 6 hours. Altogether 19 and half hours are spent for weekdays. So only 4 and half hours are left. In that why television is then for 24 hours. Well non working women's and students going to schools and colleges have extra free time. As television is for 24 hours now, then many students instead of spending their time in studying watch television more and study less. Non working women‚Äôs in their free time instead of watching television could do some other activities. Television should be shown in evening from 7pm to 8pm, cartoon shows should be shown for kids at that time. From 8pm to 9pm teenagers programs should be shown. From 9pm to 11pm programs should be shown for grown-up peoples. If you watch colour television for more than 2 hours, the rays coming from television affects your health and eyes.

At present due to problems going on in the world, 24 hours news channels are required. So we can keep news channels for 24 hours. Sports channels can also be shown for 24 hours. 

On Saturdays and Sundays television can be shown for 9 to 11am in the morning and 2 to 5pm in the afternoon and 7 to 11pm in the evening.

Also in a year so many movies are made. In a year there are 52 weeks, so only 52 movies should be produced in one country. One Sunday one movie should be watched. Their should be no production of video or CD cassettes of the picture, only uploaded in the internet, so that if anyone wants to watch any movie again, they can download and watch it again. 

Also if their are only 52 movies in a week, there would be less downloading of movies in the whole world due to which there would be less amount of internet radiation.
author: shiva koliar

text:
1.	Many Production Companies Has To Be Stopped

We manufacture so many products and it is creating pollution and pollution has increased to such an extent that it has become a threat to the world. So if we can minimise our products, pollution would be less.
We produce so many things which we do not need as a necessity, like cold drinks, leather products, potato wafers, chips, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. Cold drinks, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. should be cooked at home only. Instead of cold drinks people should drink natural drinks such as lime water, coconut water or just any fruit, not any fruit juice, just the whole fruit which can be prepared or served when a customer comes in a shop, hotel or a person selling this drinks on a street and serve it to him. If we stopped producing this things so much pollution could be reduced. Also these companies need so much water and electricity, we could give that water and electricity to places where water and electricity supply is less. As the world is facing pollution problems, we should stop producing things which is not a necessity for humans. In this way we would create less pollution. What about the companies that are going to be stopped, they would have debts to pay. The companies which cannot pay the debts just excuse them. We will think that if companies are going to be shut down then how the Industrialists and so many people who would lose their jobs, how will they survive. Well companies and people's on one side and the earth on one side, which should we save, the earth is more important.

2. We Should Cook Foods In Its Natural Form

We can cook rice and wheat in our homes and eat it. Rice and Wheat is produced in farms. Then it is packed and transported to big warehouses, then wholesalers buy from them and supply to retail shops. 
But if a manufacturing company makes bread from rice and wheat, then to make bread a manufacturing company has to be set up, machines and working staffs are needed. When a company is built many other things are also needed. Then at last a plastic pack is required to pack the breads.
So if we start cooking eatable things in its natural form then we do not need many companies like bread manufacturing company, tomato ketchup, fruit jam, pizza, burger, etc., the things required for the company and the plastic pack, paper box pack and glass bottles. If done like this, so many companies will not be required and hence less pollution for the world.
This must be done. The World is researching on how to clear the earth's pollution, but if we stopped many companies like bread manufacturing company and others which are not required as a necessity, so much pollution could be reduced and maybe we won't even have to research on how to clear the earth's pollution.

3. Pickles should not be stored

Most of the people buy pickles to eat, while some make it at home. If pickles are bought from a store then a company has also to make glass bottles to store the pickles. If made at home then still glass bottles are required to store the pickles. 
But if we make pickles at home and only cook how much is needed for one time then we won't need glass bottles to store the pickles. Glass bottles when manufactured it creates water pollution.

4. We Should Stop Using Makeup Products

Many women's all over the world do makeup. Makeup is not a necessity for humans. Instead of doing makeup to look beautiful, women's should do exercise daily. If they exercise and sweat, eat fruits daily, they would have less dead skins and be naturally beautiful. They could save so much money if they stop using makeup products. If this is done then all the makeup manufacturing companies can be shut down. In this way all the pollution resulting from the makeup manufacturing companies would also be stopped.

5. How To Reduce Transportation In The World

If one country invents a thing and then exports it to other countries in the world, much transportation is needed. Instead of that the invented thing should be taught to every countries in the world. If done like this transportation would
be less needed. Only raw materials should be imported and exported
from one country to another. Countries should not import and export eatable things if it can be produced in their own countries. If one country has excess agricultural food grains, fruits, then only that country should export that things to other countries. If this is done, so much pollution can be reduced because of less transportation.
If one country has invented a thing and they would think that if they taught other countries the method to invent that thing, then they would lose profits, but that will not be the case as other countries when they will invent a thing, they will also teach the method to invent that thing to all other countries in the world.
If pollution problem was not present then no problem, one country after inventing a thing could transport it to all other countries in the world, but now as pollution problem is present, then this should not be done.

6. Electricity Pollution

We create electricity from many types of sources like coal, water, etc., but it creates pollution. If electricity created from windmill and solar energy then no pollution occurs. But still to manufacture windmill and solar machines pollution would occur.
As I previously said that if we shut down many manufacturing companies which are producing things which are not a necessity for humans, then the world would not require so much electricity. Then maybe we could provide electricity to the whole world from windmill and Solar panels which are not pollutant. If we stopped producing electricity from coal, water, etc., then the pollution resulting from them won't occur. Shouldn't we take this step to protect our earth as already our earth is suffering so much from global warming and climate change. Is their any other choice, I don't think so. 
At present the world is researching how to solve the pollution problem, it would take how many years I don't know and also would it possible or impossible, God knows. Could we wait till that time when scientists would find how to solve pollution problems and till that the earth won't have a major natural disaster, nobody knows. We must shut down many companies which are not required as a necessity for humans.

7. Free Things To The Peoples

As I previously said to shut down many companies which are not required as a necessity for humans, if done then many would become jobless. So to solve this problem the world has to make food, clothing, shelter, medicine, surgeries and education free to the peoples. If this step is taken then we can shut down any company we want. The government's of every country should arrange agricultural lands in new places for farming and supply water and seeds and all other things necessary for farming free to the people's who have lost their source of income, if they do not have enough money to start farming on their own. If this is done then no one would starve for food and robberies can be reduced so much in the world.

8. Firecrackers should be banned

Firecrackers should be banned because it is harmful for animals. Animals have different levels of hearing and when we burst crackers which have a loud noise the dogs run away from that place. The dogs may hear the noise more louder than humans. When we fire the rocket cracker up in the sky and it bursts and if any bird is near to the explosion then that birds internal organs are damaged and they die just because of that explosion sound. Also peoples who have asthma illness, they face problems during Diwali. So much papers and threads are used in manufacturing crackers. The persons working in the manufacturing companies also suffer.
Now when their are animals rights for not harming them, then this step of banning firecrackers must be taken.

9. Hair cutting salons are not required

Instead of cutting our hair and shaving our beard in a salon, if everybody learns how to cut hair, then in a family everybody can cut each other's hair. If this is done then no need of hair cutting salons. All those hair cutting places can be used for other purposes.
We require scissors, blades, razors, shaving brush and shaving creams for hair cut and beard shaving. What if we use a hair removing soap for our hair cut and shaving purposes. Their is a soap for hair removal and it is also cheap. For women's who need hair cut for them scissors has to be used to cut the hair, no choice for that, but for men's hair cut and beard shaving if hair removing soap is used, he would become bald, but if we do this then we won't need to manufacture blades, razors, shaving brush and creams. All those manufacturing companies can be shut down and hence less pollution for the world.
People use hair dye to colour their hairs. The hair dye manufacturing companies after production dumps its waste in rivers or seas which pollutes the water. So all hair dye manufacturing companies should be shut down. For the sake of our planet earth this step must be taken.

10. We Can Stop Eating Sweets, Cakes

We consume sweets and cakes. We make it from many things such as wheat, coconut, etc. and add sugar to it. But what we want is the sweet thing to consume which we are getting directly from fruits. The fruit is naturally sweet. So if we want to consume sweets and cakes, we do not have to prepare it, just we have to eat fruits. So all the sweet manufacturing companies can be shut down. If you shut down a sweet manufacturing company, then so many paper boxes need not be manufactured which are used to pack the sweets.

text: There is no equilibrium. The reason the earth is warming up is that it is trapping more energy, but it isnt co2 that is doing the trapping. Glaciers are melting and as a result more water is increasing its energy levels and that is where the temperature increases come from.
author: robert hicks

text: ¬†@robert hicks¬† if the Earth is warming will it not radiate more energy?. If water has more energy it will radiate more energy, I do not understand the concept of trapping energy, it is a fundamental law that energy will always spread out trying to create an equilibrium with its surroundings. You say there is no equilibrium, are you saying that the average temperature of the Earth is not defined by the Sun? Can you explain what determines it? I agree that water vapour can absorb energy in the short term, making the difference between day and night temperatures less, but it cannot retain energy to make the Earth' s long term temperature higher than the temperature determined by the Energy from the Sun. The only factor that could slow the loss of energy from the Earth is if it's surroundings became warmer, as Space is infinitely cold, this will not happen.
author: Stefan Pijanowski

text:
¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† Satellites have shown that the infrared that co2 emits is increasingly leaving the planet. Ice and liquid water are the same except for the amount of energy they hold. Water is not very good at releasing energy, until it gets really hot. Co2 on the other hand will release very it quickly, as long as it is not frozen. The maximum average temperature is determined by the sun, the orbit of the earth, the tilt of the earth, the distance to the sun, and the reflectivity of the earth. IF the earth was at the maximum temperature, it would not have any ice on the earth. Its way to complicated to say the temperature of the sun is the cause of warming or not.
During the little ice age, the earth cooled as the result of increase reflectivity. This caused glaciers to expand as less ice melted in the summer than was laid down in the winter. After the little ice age ended, the reflectivity decreased and again and more of the suns energy was absorbed. As a result, more water was added to the ocean in the summer than was added to the glaciers in the winter.
author: robert hicks

text: ¬†@robert hicks¬† I understand that over time the amount of energy the Earth receives from the Sun changes for the reasons you give. The CO2 Climate change debate is about changes in the very short term when the factors you mention are not significant. My understanding is that CO2 interacts with radiation around the 15 micrometre range and within the first 10mtrs of the surface it essentially converts the radiation into kinetic energy in the air molecules around it. Satellite data shows that radiation in this range  is not being emitted by the Earth into Space. I am confused by what you say about water, it requires significant energy to raise its temperature and consequently when it is no longer being heated it will take longer for its temperature to fall. The rate that energy transfers from warmer to cooler depends mainly on the temperature difference that exists. The point I am trying to make is that a change to Earth's atmosphere cannot result in a change in the energy leaving the planet. The Earth has to stay in equilibrium with the energy it receives from the Sun.
author: Stefan Pijanowski

text:
¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† Im sorry but it appears your understanding of co2 isnt correct. It has a range of frequencies it can absorb. it has a range it can emit on, but it primarily emits on one. That frequency is one that water vapor absorbs readily. It can also convert energy it absorbs from collisions with other atoms into infrared energy and emit it as well. This means that it absorbs energy from water vapor and emits it as infrared.
When the infrared is around water, such as the water in the body, it gets absorbed rapidly but when it is above the level in the atmosphere that water vapor exist, half of the energy it release leaves the planet. Increases in co2 results in increases in the infrared leaving the planet.
There is a balance of energy that the earth receives and emit, but for the last 3 centuries the balance has been negative, i.e. the earth is retaining a good bit of the energy it receives. That energy is being stored in the water as it is warmed from ice to liquid. Its easier to think of water as the earth heat battery. When the earth loses its heat charge, the water freezes. When the earth energy recharges, the ice melts.
"The Earth has to stay in equilibrium with the energy it receives from the Sun." THis only happens if there earth is at maximum temperature for its position in the solar system and its angle. Until we reach that maximum temperature there is a negative balance as the earth tries to reach equaliberum.
author: robert hicks

text:
¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† Look at it this way. You have a house that has a lot of windows. Because the sun is able to get in readily from all angles, it keeps a balance temperature in the house, as the energy that it receives from the sun balances the energy escaping. Gradually, the temperature changes as the day progresses. Then the door opens and the temperature drops drastically.

When the door is closed again, the temperature gradually warms to reach the equilibrium again, even as the sun is going down causing that equilibrium point to decrease.
This is what is happening to the earth.
author: robert hicks

text: ¬†@robert hicks¬† I studied the courses on the "Earth's Atmosphere" and "Radiation" by  Michel van Biezen on YouTube. The Astronomy - Ch. 9.1: Earth's Atmosphere (1 of 61) Atmospheric Content gives a details explanation of the way that the Sun's radiation interacts with the Earth's Atmosphere. It contradicts a lot that you are saying. Have a look, tell me where he gets the physics wrong.

¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† OF course he does, he doesnt want people to question the socialist demands.
I dont have an agenda. He is making a video, so there is money involved. Follow the money.

text: ¬†@robert hicks¬† Before you make such comments I suggest you look at "Learning on Line" it is a massive series of videos that covers every aspect of Physics and Maths and is clearly aimed at Education not Profit. If after watching the videos, you can spot any political agenda do let me know.
author: Stefan Pijanowski

text: ¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† What I find when i google that is thousands of learning sites from kindergarten to doctorates, some of them very obviously politically driven, some of them put up because of the virus.
author: robert hicks

text: When I first saw you claim that this video said I was wrong, I responded the way I did because I have seen many people claim that they have "scientist" with obvious political biases trying to claim this or that. I can not find where this guy has said something that disagrees with me. Can you point to a video that says differently than what I said?
author: robert hicks

text: ¬†@robert hicks¬† You said "CO2 emits increasingly leaving the planet." and "CO2 absorbs energy from water vapour and emits it as infrared". You told me my understanding of CO2 was incorrect after I had summarised the action of CO2 as explained in the videos 45-51 in the series I pointed to. I think to  understand the logic of the videos you need to follow them from the start. The other series on Radiation is also a good introduction into how energy transfers through radiation. My only interest in discussions such as we are having is to test my current understanding of the science against the understanding of others and if it reveals flaws in my thinking to learn from it.
author: Stefan Pijanowski

text:
¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† What I said was correct. NASA satellites has shown an increase in infrared leaving the planet as co2 increases. In the early 1980's and late 1970's alarmist were insisting that co2 would increase the temperature of the stratosphere. 
SOME (not many) people said co2 would not rise to the stratosphere. NASA countered by pointing to the increase in infrared coming from the stratosphere as proof. The rest of the "deniers" pointed out that this increase proved that co2 was not trapping heat, and NASA stopped talking about it.
Water vapor does not release infrared unless it gets really hot. As it rises in the atmosphere because of the heat, the water vapor encounters less air pressure and thus lower temperatures, meaning it will have more trouble releasing the energy via infrared. It can easily lose that energy via convection when low energy co2 hits it. Co2 can easily release the energy via infrared (as long as it is vapor, not dry ice). So in the upper atmosphere, a "cold" co2 will hit the water vapor, release its infrared causing it to be cold again and hit another water vapor molecule. Half of that infrared will head upwards, and since it will be above the water vapor at that point, will not be reabsorbed.
What I meant by your understanding was not correct is that 18% of the earths radiation will travel through the atmosphere because it is frequencies that the atmosphere can not absorb, but the rest will be absorbed. The distance it can travel depends on thickness of the ghg. As an example, in Antarctica, where there is no water vapor, increases in co2 causes the temperature to drop because there is  so little ghg to absorb it. Water vapor is the ghg that absorbs more of infrared the earth releases.
The biggest problem is that you seemed to believe that the earth is in equilibrium. IF the earth received EXACTLY as much energy as it released, it would not change its temperature. NASA has shown that there is a small discrepancy between the receiving and losing energy, resulting in the earth warming. As co2 increases the discrepancy decreases.
author: robert hicks

text:
¬†@robert hicks¬† An object that has no internal source of energy that is sitting in the absolute cold of Space must reach an equilibrium temperature based on the energy delivered by an external source. What the temperature will be is determined by the amount of energy absorbed rather than reflected by the object. Clearly if the energy reflected increases the temperature will be lower. Similarly if the energy of from the source changes the temperature will change. It is the idea that a body can retain energy to increase its temperature and as a result appear cooler to an outside observer (less energy being radiated implies a lower temperature) I find difficult to accept. If a body increases in temperature as a result of retaining energy, it must in turn radiate more energy. It cannot be warmer and radiate less.  Equilibrium will always be restored. 
Any energy from infrared radiation that CO2 interacts with is either passed to other molecules kinetically or re-emitted in femto-seconds.I think our views on this issue are so different there is little point in continuing the discussion.
author: Stefan Pijanowski

text:
¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† "An object that has no internal source of energy that is sitting in the absolute cold of Space must reach an equilibrium temperature based on the energy delivered by an external source" This is only true if the object is static. For instance Mercury is tidal locked, meaning it always shows the same face to the sun and the other side always faces away. This means the surface facing the sun is always the same temperature and the face away is always the same.
The earth is different. Clouds, snow and such reflect the sun's light on a continually changing pattern. The energy that the earth absorbs is there fore constantly changing. When more energy is reflected and radiated than is absorbed, the water loses its energy thus enters a lower state, i.e. ice. Then when the earth absorbs more than it reflects+radiates, the water stores more energy and thus changes to the liquid state.
What this means is the the equilibrium is not stable. In the long term, the amount of energy that is reflected and radiated will match the energy the earth receives. BUT for the short term, there is no equilibrium. IF you were to take the total energy over a million years, it would be so close that it would have to be said to be the same BUT over short term, like a century or even a thousand years, no, it is too variable.
author: robert hicks

text: ¬†@Stefan Pijanowski¬† "I think our views on this issue are so different there is little point in continuing the discussion." I really hope that you will continue, because the reality is, our views are not that far apart.
author: robert hicks

text: CO2 is a tiny fraction of the atmosphere and has very little effect on temperature plus its temperature effect varies with logarithmic CO2 content.  If 400ppm is 1 degree C, the next degree takes an additional 800ppm,  the next 1600ppm.   Sea levels are not rising in fact in many places they are decreasing. World-leading sea-level expert Prof. emeritus¬†Nils Axel M√∂rner presents some stark examples that show how the IPCC and climate activists are wildly exaggerating their claims of rapid sea level rise.¬†M√∂rner studied the Kattegat Sea between Denmark and Sweden. In this region, sea level has not increased as announced by climate alarmists but instead decreased.¬†Stockholm‚Äôs tide record is the second longest in Europe; the mean long-term change in sea level is a decline of 3.8 mm per year.  In addition, Every temperature chart published shows CO2 lagging temperature change not driving it.  Every model produced by these "scientists" is completely wrong and had they not faked the historical data making it colder, the change in temperatures would be even less than we have.  The only model anywhere near a real reduction is the Russian atmospheric model.  Every model produced by others has been proven drastically wrong.   Please, No more anecdotal evidence,   you are going to have to show me the hard data, not the proverbial "hot air" explanations.  BTW,  water vapor is the 90% driver of atmospheric temperature change as every cloud has a latent heat exchange warming the atmosphere.  The latest NASA photos show a greening earth which will benefit mankind.

text:
An MIT-trained scientist who has specialized for nearly 25 years in abnormal weather and climate change published a book explaining why he believes the data underpinning global-warming science are unreliable.

Mototaka Nakamura, who earned a doctorate of science from MIT, has conducted his work at prestigious institutions such as MIT, Georgia Institute of Technology, NASA, Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology and Duke University,¬†reported the website Electroverse.

In his book "The Global Warming Hypothesis is an Unproven Hypothesis," Nakamura explained why global mean temperatures before 1980 are based on "untrustworthy data."

text: ¬†@andrew williams¬† "Paleo records hint that it usually takes much longer to shift CO2 concentrations in the atmosphere; although researchers can‚Äôt see what happened on time frames as short as decades in the distant past, the fastest blips they can see were an order of magnitude slower than what‚Äôs happening today. text:
¬†@HelmerNisse¬† 
Before the industrial revolution, the CO2 content in the air remained quite steady for thousands of years. Natural CO2 is not static, however. It is generated by natural processes, and absorbed by others. But consider what happens when more CO2 is released from outside of the natural carbon cycle ‚Äì by burning fossil fuels. Although our output of 29 gigatons of CO2 is tiny compared to the 750 gigatons moving through the carbon cycle each year, it adds up because the land and ocean cannot absorb all of the extra CO2. About 40% of this additional CO2 is absorbed. The rest remains in the atmosphere, and as a consequence, atmospheric CO2 is at its highest level in millions of years. (A natural change of 100ppm normally takes 5,000 to 20,000 years. The recent increase of has taken just 120 years).

Hypothetically, even if the hockey stick was busted (and it was not)... What of it? The case for anthropogenic global warming originally came from studies of climate mechanics, not from reconstructions of past temperatures seeking a cause. Warnings about current warming trends came out years before Mann's hockey-stick graph. Even if the world were incontrovertibly warmer 1,000 years ago, it would not change the fact that the recent rapid rise in CO2 explains the current episode of warming more credibly than any natural factor does‚Äîand that no natural factor seems poised to offset further warming in the years ahead.
author: Hosni Mubarak

text:
¬†@HelmerNisse¬† 
The ice in Antarctica is made up of snows that fell on the continent over millions of years.
As this ice was pressed down, it captured bubbles of air. These little gas pockets are a direct snapshot of the atmosphere.
Scientists take ice core samples and read off the levels of carbon dioxide and other heat-trapping components such as methane, for example.
Analysing the atoms in the water-ice molecules encasing the gases also gives an indication of the temperatures that persisted at the time of precipitation.

text:
¬†@HelmerNisse¬† 
The approach to downplay the significance of climate change was copied from tobacco lobbyists; in the face of scientific evidence linking tobacco to lung cancer, to prevent or delay the introduction of regulation. Lobbyists attempted to discredit the scientific research by creating doubt

and manipulating debate. They worked to discredit the scientists involved, to dispute their findings, and to create and maintain an apparent controversy by promoting claims that contradicted scientific research.
The tobacco industry has historically relied on a dismissal of correlational evidence to reject a link between tobacco and lung cancer.
For example, the tobacco industry abused this fallacy to argue that simply because smoking correlates with lung cancer that does not mean that smoking causes lung cancer. The simple correlation is not enough to arrive at a conclusion of causation.
Today however, nobody in their right mind would deny smoking causes cancer.

text:
Facts speak louder than any unproven theory. 
(1) The sea level debate became an even larger can of worms in 2018. The University of Colorado, which manages the Jason satellites on contract to NASA, reported that not only had there been no acceleration of sea level rise in the satellite data there had been a deceleration in the last decade (2008-2018); so even the satellite data had not been able to detect acceleration of sea level! (Source: Thank God for Tide Gauges, Howard T Brady, Spectator Magazine)
(2) The Maldives was predicted to sink underwater completely by 2018. But this DID NOT happen. Sea level expert Morner discovered not only sea level has NOT risen for the Maldives, it has fallen. (Source: Wattsupwiththat dot com)
(3) Tuvalu, instead of sinking, is GROWING in size. (Source: Phys dot Org website)

text: Looks like the greenhouse effect is an adiabatic (pressure-induced) process and therefore doesn't depend on the composition of the atmosphere. The CO2 concentration in the atmosphere is thus irrelevant to the greenhouse effect, because its concentration in the atmosphere doesn't affect the intensity of such effect. Here's the DOI code of such scientific paper: 10.4172/2573-458X.1000112

text: Naive Malarky. CO2 has risen to levels not seen in twelve million years. Yet temperatures haven't budged one bit from the last twelve thousand year Holocene interglacial average. Temperatures have been naturally increasing since the Little Ice Age in the 1600s. The thermometer was invented in an uptrend one hundred years later. A natural uptrend that has only reached halfway up the natural historical pattern of the Holocene. The thermometer hasn't been around long enough to understand how much today's climate is completely normal. In our current Holocene interglacial, temperatures have risen and fallen at least four degrees C (~8 degrees F) at least a dozen times. Today we're right in the middle of that twelve thousand year range. The late twentieth century coincidental rise of CO2 with temperature is just that - coincidental. Temperatures rose just as much and just as fast during the early twentieth century before any significant CO2 rise. The temperature change is completely normal. The CO2 increase is not. (normal CO2 during our Holocene interglacial has been 180-280ppm) probably from a combination of fossil fuel use and aggressive land clearing. But since CO2 is NOT THE CONTROL KNOB OF CLIMATE, has an increase in CO2 been harmful or beneficial? The answer is COMPLETELY BENEFICIAL. A little more CO2, in the context of the 600 million year natural decline of CO2 from 7000ppm to today's natural near lethally low levels, a little more CO2 has been a Godsend.

text: Looks like the greenhouse effect is an adiabatic (pressure-induced) process and therefore doesn't depend on the composition of the atmosphere. The CO2 concentration in the atmosphere is thus irrelevant to the greenhouse effect, because its concentration in the atmosphere doesn't affect the intensity of such effect. Here's the DOI code of such scientific paper: 10.4172/2573-458X.1000112

text: The sources are terrible. Following the link, you get to each ..ahem, "fact" which gives you another link to another presentation of "facts" like this video. You could perpetually cite each other as sources. The claims about the rate of sea level rise, land and sea ice extent aren't true according to CSIRO, MASIE, the National Snow and Ice Data centre respectively. What piqued my interest is the claim regarding solar energy dropping (a minimum happens in cycles that should lower average temperature similar to 1941-1979) but a rise is still observed. This, as far as I'm aware, is the environmentalist link suggesting the "human caused," "unnatural" warming that is down to CO2. I've seen a few videos that briefly mention this near the end, but don't expand on it or link to any studies regarding the data for the solar activity. Again, looking at NASA/SDO data, the drop in solar activity hasn't happened yet, so are these 11 year cycle graphs simply further projections of future climate?

I think point 5 might be misleading.

Given that terrestrial radiation is from the surface and greenhouse gases such as water and co2 are found more closely to the lower atmosphere because of gravity (they are heavier) it only makes sense that the lower atmosphere would cook more regardless. The sun's activities wouldn't affect the atmosphere in they way they was stated.

What we can say is that there would be increase in available energy in the lower atmosphere which is paired with more water vapour, co2, etc

TLDR : Sun won't cook atmosphere top. Greenhouse gas don't go that high anyways.

I still have a problem with the mass of co2 we have... only 400ppm   -PARTS PER MILLION?   $400 OF A MILLION DOLLARS IS ...NOTHING!    400 pennies weighs about 2 pounds..  1 million pennies is 2.5 tons!!!   Heat up 2 lb of copper of 5000 pounds of copper is nothing!   My second point is sublimation.    Co2 will not condense into a liquid.  IT DOES ON VENUS BUT not ON EARTH OR MARS! 
They point to Venus and say the co2 is responsible for its 900-degree heat.  Venus has 90 times the pressure of Earth and will allow its co2 to be effective as a greenhouse gas!


  When Mars has roughly the same amount of c02 concentration and is ineffective in heating Mars.  The difference is Sublimation ie Pressure allows the co2 in venus to condense into a liquid.  Mars and Earth do not have enough pressure for co2 to condense.  Dry ice goes from solid to gas skipping the liquid phase.   It is why science and the physics on Earth does not consider Oxygen or nitrogen or Argon as a greenhouse gas.     
The reason is you cannot blame water vapor that is the major greenhouse gas because water vapor does confidence.   Water in the state of Ice will melt into a liquid then to a gas phase and it reverses the same.   


Yessssssss! the earth is heating up!  but co2 is not the reason. The earth has been heating up since the last Ice age.. and Yes faster right now... Reason?   If you have a full glass of ice water and the ice will melt slowly.. but the last ice cube melts faster then the full glass.    We are at the tail end of the melting... It is melting faster!  
If you had a pot of stew  ... the items in the stew do not add heat.   Turn up the burner (the sun) and the stew will get hotter   Not the Items in the stew.

text:
According to the Vostok Ice Core Records, CO2 level changes have followed Earth's overall temperature changes at an 800 year lag for the last 800,000 years.  That means that our current CO2 levels are the result of Earth's overall temperature 800 years ago.  World leaders have convinced their dependents that this works in the reverse order, relatively quickly, and that we are to blame, so that they can tax us out of a false shared guilt in order to be able to afford to "fight" climate change, an unstoppable natural cycle.  The following is the source of this information:

Historical Carbon Dioxide Record from the Vostok Ice Core

Investigators
J.-M. Barnola, D. Raynaud, C. Lorius
Laboratoire de Glaciologie et de G√©ophysique de l'Environnement,
CNRS, BP96,
38402 Saint Martin d'Heres Cedex, France

N.I. Barkov
Arctic and Antarctic Research Institute,
Beringa Street 38, 199397,
St. Petersburg, Russia

Period of Record
417,160 - 2,342 years BP

Methods
In January 1998, the collaborative ice-drilling project between Russia, the United States, and France at the Russian Vostok station in East Antarctica yielded the deepest ice core ever recovered, reaching a depth of 3,623 m (Petit et al. 1997, 1999). Ice cores are unique with their entrapped air inclusions enabling direct records of past changes in atmospheric trace-gas composition. Preliminary data indicate the Vostok ice-core record extends through four climate cycles, with ice slightly older than 400 kyr (Petit et al. 1997, 1999). Because air bubbles do not close at the surface of the ice sheet but only near the firn-ice transition (that is, at ~90 m below the surface at Vostok), the air extracted from the ice is younger than the surrounding ice (Barnola et al. 1991). Using semiempirical models of densification applied to past Vostok climate conditions, Barnola et al. (1991) reported that the age difference between air and ice may be ~6000 years during the coldest periods instead of ~4000 years, as previously assumed. Ice samples were cut with a bandsaw in a cold room (at about -15¬∞C) as close as possible to the center of the core in order to avoid surface contamination (Barnola et al. 1983). Gas extraction and measurements were performed with the "Grenoble analytical setup," which involved crushing the ice sample (~40 g) under vacuum in a stainless-steel container without melting it, expanding the gas released during the crushing in a pre-evacuated sampling loop, and analyzing the CO2 concentrations by gas chromatography (Barnola et al. 1983). The analytical system, except for the stainless-steel container in which the ice was crushed, was calibrated for each ice sample measurement with a standard mixture of CO2 in nitrogen and oxygen. For further details on the experimental procedures and the dating of the successive ice layers at Vostok, see Barnola et al. (1987, 1991), Lorius et al. (1985), and Petit et al. (1999).

Trends
There is a close correlation between Antarctic temperature and atmospheric concentrations of CO2 (Barnola et al. 1987). The extension of the Vostok CO2 record shows that the main trends of CO2 are similar for each glacial cycle. Major transitions from the lowest to the highest values are associated with glacial-interglacial transitions. During these transitions, the atmospheric concentrations of CO2 rises from 180 to 280-300 ppmv (Petit et al. 1999). The extension of the Vostok CO2 record shows the present-day levels of CO2 are unprecedented during the past 420 kyr. Pre-industrial Holocene levels (~280 ppmv) are found during all interglacials, with the highest values (~300 ppmv) found approximately 323 kyr BP. When the Vostok ice core data were compared with other ice core data (Delmas et al. 1980; Neftel et al. 1982) for the past 30,000 - 40,000 years, good agreement was found between the records: all show low CO2 values [~200 parts per million by volume (ppmv)] during the Last Glacial Maximum and increased atmospheric CO2 concentrations associated with the glacial-Holocene transition. According to Barnola et al. (1991) and Petit et al. (1999) these measurements indicate that, at the beginning of the deglaciations, the CO2 increase either was in phase or lagged by less than ~1000 years with respect to the Antarctic temperature, whereas it clearly lagged behind the temperature at the onset of the glaciations.

References
Barnola, J.-M., D. Raynaud, A. Neftel, and H. Oeschger. 1983. Comparison of CO2 measurements by two laboratories on air from bubbles in polar ice. Nature 303:410-13.

Barnola, J.-M., D. Raynaud, Y.S. Korotkevich, and C. Lorius. 1987. Vostok ice core provides 160,000-year record of atmospheric CO2. Nature 329:408-14.

Barnola, J.-M., P. Pimienta, D. Raynaud, and Y.S. Korotkevich. 1991. CO2-climate relationship as deduced from the Vostok ice core: A re-examination based on new measurements and on a re-evaluation of the air dating. Tellus 43(B):83- 90.

Delmas, R.J., J.-M. Ascencio, and M. Legrand. 1980. Polar ice evidence that atmospheric CO2 20,000 yr BP was 50% of present. Nature 284:155-57.

Jouzel, J., C. Lorius, J.R. Petit, C. Genthon, N.I. Barkov, V.M. Kotlyakov, and V.M. Petrov. 1987. Vostok ice core: A continuous isotopic temperature record over the last climatic cycle (160,000 years). Nature 329:403-8.

Lorius, C., J. Jouzel, C. Ritz, L. Merlivat, N.I. Barkov, Y.S. Korotkevich, and V.M. Kotlyakov. 1985. A 150,000-year climatic record from Antarctic ice. Nature 316:591-96.

Neftel, A., H. Oeschger, J. Schwander, B. Stauffer, and R. Zumbrunn. 1982. Ice core measurements give atmospheric CO2 content during the past 40,000 yr. Nature 295:220-23.

Pepin, L., D. Raynaud, J.-M. Barnola, and M.F. Loutre. 2001. Hemispheric roles of climate forcings during glacial-interglacial transitions as deduced from the Vostok record and LLN-2D model experiments. Journal of Geophysical Research 106 (D23): 31,885-31,892.

Petit, J.R., I. Basile, A. Leruyuet, D. Raynaud, C. Lorius, J. Jouzel, M. Stievenard, V.Y. Lipenkov, N.I. Barkov, B.B. Kudryashov, M. Davis, E. Saltzman, and V. Kotlyakov. 1997. Four climate cycles in Vostok ice core. Nature 387: 359-360.

Petit, J.R., J. Jouzel, D. Raynaud, N.I. Barkov, J.-M. Barnola, I. Basile, M. Benders, J. Chappellaz, M. Davis, G. Delayque, M. Delmotte, V.M. Kotlyakov, M. Legrand, V.Y. Lipenkov, C. Lorius, L. P√©pin, C. Ritz, E. Saltzman, and M. Stievenard. 1999. Climate and atmospheric history of the past 420,000 years from the Vostok ice core, Antarctica. Nature 399: 429-436.

Raynaud, D., and J.-M. Barnola. 1985. An Antarctic ice core reveals atmospheric CO2 variations over the past few centuries. Nature 315:309-11.

CITE AS: Barnola, J.-M., D. Raynaud, C. Lorius, and N.I. Barkov. 2003. Historical CO2 record from the Vostok ice core. In Trends: A Compendium of Data on Global Change. Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, U.S. Department of Energy, Oak Ridge, Tenn., U.S.A.

Revised February 2003

text:
One of the most common misconceptions concerns the so-called ‚Äúscientific proofs.‚Äù  Contrary to popular belief, there is no such thing as scientific proof.
Proofs exist only in mathematics and logic, not in science.  Mathematics and logic are both closed, self-contained systems of propositions, whereas science is empirical and deals with nature as it exists.  The primary criterion and standard of evaluation of scientific theory is evidence, not proof.  All else equal (such as internal logical consistency and parsimony), scientists prefer theories for which there is more and better evidence to theories for which there is less and worse evidence.  Proofs are not the currency of science.

Proofs have two features that do not exist in science:  They are final, and they are binary.  Once a theorem is proven, it will forever be true and there will be nothing in the future that will threaten its status as a proven theorem (unless a flaw is discovered in the proof).  Apart from the discovery of an error, a proven theorem will forever and always be a proven theorem.

In contrast, all scientific knowledge is tentative and provisional, and nothing is final.  There is no such thing as final proven knowledge in science.  The currently accepted theory of a phenomenon is simply the best explanation for it among all available alternatives.  Its status as the accepted theory is contingent on what other theories are available and might suddenly change tomorrow if there appears a better theory or new evidence that might challenge the accepted theory.  No knowledge or theory (which embodies scientific knowledge) is final.  Your entire assertion it is settled is in fact not scientific and just a belief system.

author: Appable

text: I wasn't furiously attacking climate change. I was making a general comment on how the public tends to view and¬†interpret scientific data. And specifically in regards to climate change, this is causing a state of panic and mob-mentality. This has led people to blindly assume, in the name of science, that humans will go extinct.¬†Considering¬†such drastic consequences, based on¬†so little we know about climate science, a field already riddled with so many unknown¬†unknown variables, warrants additional skepticism. Again, I'm not saying¬†climate scientists are¬†wrong (in fact, they're more likely to be right than anyone else on this world), but I would be much more hesitant before jumping to extreme conclusions as to what and to what degree those effects will be.As for my personal opinion on climate change, I'm still trying to find a stance, which is why I was watching this video. I do believe that there is a good chance that climate change is real and that humans influenced it, but the outcome of these events (extinction, or other extreme consequences), to me, seem way over exaggerated. I do, however, full heartedly support making changes to have a cleaner environment, for health reasons and to stay on the cautious side. I'm pretty new to this topic and in the process of learning more.¬†Maybe you could enlighten me.
author: SJ Park

text: ¬†@SJ Park¬† I don't think much if any of the literature jumps to extreme consequences, for what it's worth. Certainly not human extinction, though ecosystem disruption leading to extinctions of a number of species (and loss in biodiversity) is definitely a real potential consequence. That seems to be largely media driven

text:
"The sun's energy comes to earth largely as visible light. CO2 and methane are transparent to visible light.  The light heats up the earth.  The warm earth radiates energy back into space, cooling it.  The energy radiated back out is primarily infrared light.  CO2 and methane are opaque to infrared light, so they prevent that energy from going back into space.

A greenhouse gas is any gas that is transparent to visible to light and opaque to infrared light.  "Stronger" greenhouse gasses are more opaque to infrared than weaker greenhouse gasses." Best way to sum it all up. Not everything is a conspiracy by the way.

text:
A company has to make a profit or at least break even. IF you increase their cost, such as a tax, then they have to pass it on to their customer. They can not eat the cost, or it means they have a lost. IF they lose money for long, they go bankrupt.

Lets say there is a company making donuts. That company has a gas fired oven for banking. They buy flour and sugar, and other farmed products.

The government adds a carbon tax to the farmers, flour¬†mills, the shippers and to the gas company. The farmers have to get more money, or they lose the farm. The mills first have to pay more for the wheat, then¬†get taxed for their carbon use and they have to get more money for their flour. Others have to pay¬†more for sugar, and for their production of the¬†sugar.¬†Then the stores have to pay more for the flour and sugar, so the baker has to pay more for their product or go out of business. On top of that they have an increase in taxes because of their stove.

The result is the cost of the donuts go up by 50% to pay for all the taxes. That means the customers pay more for a tax that is not put on them.

You are not told the truth about co2. 
1) It is a very tiny part of the atmosphere, only .0004 part of the atmosphere.
2) it is not a ghg in the same way that water vapor is. H2o can not release much in the way of infrared but co2 is. That is the reason we have co2 lasers and not h2o lasers. In fact, co2 lasers are the most common lasers in the industry. Low powered ones are used for alignment and high power are used for cutting materials. They can be used to drill very precise holes in steel or tougher metals. They are even used by the¬†navy to knock down missiles on some of their newer ships.

What co2 is, is a REGULATORY gas. That means if the temperature is low, it helps to slow temperature leaving the planet, but it if gets too high it helps to get rid of the excess.

Nasa satellites have proven that increasing co2 increases the amount of energy that is leaving the planet.

Those experiments are designed to fool you. The fact is, co2 emits infrared in a small range of frequency, which is absorbed by h2o. Those cups have both co2 and h2o. This means the co2 will absorb the infrared, then the glass prevents that infrared from leaving the jar. Instead it gets absorbed by the water vapor and thus warms the jar.

IF you do the same experiment without the water vapor AND with walls that are transparent to infrared, it does NOT heat up.

YES you can make models that will tell you anything they are designed to show you. IF you program the model to show that the atmosphere has a sensitivity of over 2¬∞, it will show a major increase. If on the other hand, you program it to show a sensitivity of less than 1¬∞ it does not do so.

Here is the rub. EVERY model with a sensitivity of greater than 1¬∞ is off in 20 years. The way to test a model is to take the data from the past, say 100 years ago, and see if it matches what happened. Not one of their models can do that. They cant even do it if you give it the data from 20 years ago.

There is one model that can accurately predict the preset. It was created in the late 1940, and it totally ignore co2. After 70 years, its prediction are only off by +1¬∞, i.e. it said it would be 1¬∞ hotter than it is.

This model was created using the melting of the glaciers as the CAUSE of global warming, not the result. They noted that there is evidence of a 60 year cycle, and other smaller cycles (12, 5, and 6 year cycles). When they ran these cycles, they got almost the exact warming we have had for the almost 80 years since.

In other words, the only model that has been proven to be closest to reality, is one that has an atmospheric¬†sensitivity to changes in co2¬†of zero.

Yes, we have never increased co2 this fast, but the temperature is going up just the same as it in the first half of the 1900's.
